pageContext.claim: “[The Clinton campaign] knew something was going on because they didn't pay the final payment for the fireworks two weeks before, right? I went to the fireworks company, and I said, 'I'll give you five cents on the dollar for your fireworks.' Even though they were nowhere near where my area was, we were in a hotel in Midtown, we liked the location better than where she chose. But they built the most -- remember that beautiful stage? It was shaped like the United States of America.”
pageContext.analysis: When Trump’s victory was clear, Clinton was forced to cancel the planned fireworks display over the Hudson River. There’s no reports that the campaign didn't pay for the display or that Trump bought the fireworks.
